article.title: Coffin Texts
article.p:
Coffin Texts
, collection of ancient Egyptian funerary texts consisting of spells or magic formulas, painted on the burial coffins of the First Intermediate period (
c.
2130–1938
bce
) and the Middle Kingdom (1938–
c.
1630
bce
). The Coffin Texts, combined with the
Pyramid Texts
from which they were derived, were the primary sources of the
Book of the Dead
, which was in prominent use during the New Kingdom and Late period. These three collections represent the most extensive body of Egyptian religious literature available to modern scholars.
